socket.description: The socket file to use for connection.

lease.description: Schema lease duration, very dangerous to change only if you know what you do.

split-table.description: When create table, split a separated region for it. It is recommended toturn off this option if there will be a large number of tables created.

token-limit.description: The limit of concurrent executed sessions.

temp-dir.description: The temporary directory to store the intermediate compute results.

tmp-storage-path.description: Specifies the temporary storage path for some operators when a single SQL statement exceeds the memory quota specified by the memory quota.It defaults to a generated directory in `<TMPDIR>/<os/user.Current().Uid>_tidb/` if it is unset.It only takes effect when `tidb_enable_tmp_storage_on_oom` is `true`.

tmp-storage-quota.description: Specifies the maximum use of temporary storage (bytes) for all active queries when `tidb_enable_tmp_storage_on_oom` is enabled.If the `tmp-storage-quota` exceeds the capacity of the temporary storage directory, tidb-server would return an error and exit.The default value of tmp-storage-quota is under 0 which means tidb-server wouldn't check the capacity.

compatible-kill-query.description: Make "kill query" behavior compatible with MySQL. It's not recommend toturn on this option when TiDB server is behind a proxy.

graceful-wait-before-shutdown.description: Make SIGTERM wait N seconds before starting the shutdown procedure. This is designed for when TiDB is behind a proxy/load balancer.The health check will fail immediately but the server will not start shutting down until the time has elapsed.

treat-old-version-utf8-as-utf8mb4.description: treat-old-version-utf8-as-utf8mb4 use for upgrade compatibility. Set to true will treat old version table/column UTF8 charset as UTF8MB4.

max-index-length.description: max-index-length is used to deal with compatibility issues from v3.0.7 and previous version upgrades. It can only be in [3072, 3072*4].

index-limit.description: index-limit is used to deal with compatibility issues. It can only be in [64, 64*8].

enable-table-lock.description: enable-table-lock is used to control table lock feature. Default is false, indicate the table lock feature is disabled.

delay-clean-table-lock.description: delay-clean-table-lock is used to control the time (Milliseconds) of delay before unlock the table in the abnormal situation.

split-region-max-num.description: Maximum number of the splitting region, which is used by the split region statement.

alter-primary-key.description: alter-primary-key is used to control whether the primary keys are clustered.Note that this config is deprecated. Only valid when @@global.tidb_enable_clustered_index = 'int_only'.Default is false, only the integer primary keys are clustered.If it is true, all types of primary keys are nonclustered.

server-version.description: server-version is used to change the version string of TiDB in the following scenarios:1. the server version returned by builtin-function `VERSION()`.2. the server version filled in handshake packets of MySQL Connection Protocol, see https://dev.mysql.com/doc/dev/mysql-server/latest/page_protocol_connection_phase_packets_protocol_handshake_v10.html for more details.if server-version = "", the default value(original TiDB version string) is used.

repair-mode.description: repair mode is used to repair the broken table meta in TiKV in extreme cases.

repair-table-list.description: Repair table list is used to list the tables in repair mode with the format like ["db.table",].In repair mode, repairing table which is not in repair list will get wrong database or wrong table error.

new_collations_enabled_on_first_bootstra.description: Whether new collations are enabled, as indicated by its name, this configuration entry take effect ONLY when a TiDB cluster bootstraps for the first time.

skip-register-to-dashboard.description: Don't register information of this TiDB to etcd, so this instance of TiDB won't appear in the services like dashboard.This option is useful when you want to embed TiDB into your service(i.e. use TiDB as a library).*If you want to start a TiDB service, NEVER enable this.*

enable-telemetry.description: When enabled, usage data (for example, instance versions) will be reported to PingCAP periodically for user experience analytics.If this config is set to `false` on all TiDB servers, telemetry will be always disabled regardless of the value of the global variable `tidb_enable_telemetry`.See PingCAP privacy policy for details: https://pingcap.com/en/privacy-policy/

deprecate-integer-display-length.description: deprecate-integer-display-length is used to be compatible with MySQL 8.0 in which the integer declared with display length will be returned witha warning like `Integer display width is deprecated and will be removed in a future release`.

enable-enum-length-limit.description: enable-enum-length-limit is used to deal with compatibility issues. When true, the enum/set element length is limited.According to MySQL 8.0 Refman:The maximum supported length of an individual SET element is M <= 255 and (M x w) <= 1020,where M is the element literal length and w is the number of bytes required for the maximum-length character in the character set.See https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/string-type-syntax.html for more details.

enable-global-kill.description: enable-global-kill is used to control global kill feature. When it is enabled, connection ID is globally unique and KILLcommand can be forwarded to the right TiDB instance to execute.

disaggregated-tiflash.description: disaggregated-tiflash indicates whether TiDB is in disaggregated tiflash mode, if true, MPP will runs on tiflash_compute nodes.

autoscaler-type.description: autoscaler-type indicates which type of AutoScaler will be used. Possible values are: mock, aws, gcp.Only meaningful when disaggregated-tiflash is true.

autoscaler-addr.description: autoscaler-addr is the host of AutoScaler, Only meaningful when disaggregated-tiflash is true.Only meaningful when disaggregated-tiflash is true.

autoscaler-cluster-id.description: autoscaler-cluster-id is the unique id for each TiDB cluster, which will used by AutoScaler.Only meaningful when disaggregated-tiflash is true.

use-autoscaler.description: use-autoscaler indicates whether use AutoScaler or PD for tiflash_compute nodes, only meaningful when disaggregated-tiflash is true.

in-mem-slow-query-topn-num.description: in-mem-slow-query-topn-num indicates the number of TopN slow queries stored in memory.

in-mem-slow-query-recent-num.description: in-mem-slow-query-recent-num indicates the number of recent slow queries stored in memory.

level.description: Log level: debug, info, warn, error, fatal.

format.description: Log format, one of json or text.

enable-timestamp.description: Enable automatic timestamps in log output, if not set, it will be defaulted to true.

enable-error-stack.description: Enable annotating logs with the full stack error message, if not set, it will be defaulted to false.

slow-query-file.description: Stores slow query log into separated files.

general-log-file.description: Stores general log into separated files.If it equals to empty, the general log will be written to the server log.

timeout.description: Make tidb panic if the write log operation hang for 15s

max-size.description: Max log file size in MB (upper limit to 4096MB).

max-days.description: Max log file keep days. No clean up by default.

max-backups.description: Maximum number of old log files to retain. No clean up by default.

compression.description: Compression function for rotated files.It can be empty or "gzip", empty means compression disabled.

ssl-ca.description: Path of file that contains list of trusted SSL CAs for connection with mysql client.

ssl-cert.description: Path of file that contains X509 certificate in PEM format for connection with mysql client.

ssl-key.description: Path of file that contains X509 key in PEM format for connection with mysql client.

cluster-ssl-ca.description: Path of file that contains list of trusted SSL CAs for connection with cluster components.

cluster-ssl-cert.description: Path of file that contains X509 certificate in PEM format for connection with cluster components.

cluster-ssl-key.description: Path of file that contains X509 key in PEM format for connection with cluster components.

spilled-file-encryption-method.description: Configurations of the encryption method to use for encrypting the spilled data files.Possible values are "plaintext", "aes128-ctr", if not set, it will be "plaintext" by default."plaintext" means encryption is disabled.

enable-sem.description: Security Enhanced Mode (SEM) restricts the "SUPER" privilege and requires fine-grained privileges instead.

auto-tls.description: Automatic creation of TLS certificates.Setting it to 'true' is recommended because it is safer and tie with the default configuration of MySQL.If this config is commented/missed, the value would be 'false' for the compatibility with TiDB versions that does not support it.

tls-version.description: Minium TLS version to use, e.g. "TLSv1.2"

rsa-key-size.description: The RSA Key size for automatic generated RSA keys

report-status.description: If enable status report HTTP service.

status-port.description: # status-host is the HTTP address for reporting the internal status of a TiDB server, for example:# API for prometheus: http://${status-host}:${status_port}/metrics# API for pprof:      http://${status-host}:${status_port}/debug/pprofTiDB status port.

metrics-addr.description: Prometheus pushgateway address, leaves it empty will disable push to pushgateway.

metrics-interval.description: Prometheus client push interval in second, set \"0\" to disable push to pushgateway.

record-db-qps.description: Record statements qps by database name if it is enabled.

record-db-label.description: Record database name label if it is enabled.

max-procs.description: Max CPUs to use, 0 use number of CPUs in the machine.

server-memory-quota.description: Memory size quota for tidb server, 0 means unlimited

stmt-count-limit.description: StmtCountLimit limits the max count of statement inside a transaction.

tcp-keep-alive.description: Set keep alive option for tcp connection.

tcp-no-delay.description: Set nodelay option for tcp connection.

stats-lease.description: Stats lease duration, which influences the time of analyze and stats load.

pseudo-estimate-ratio.description: Pseudo stats will be used if the ratio between the modify count androw count in statistics of a table is greater than it.

bind-info-lease.description: Bind info lease duration, which influences the duration of loading bind info and handling invalid bind.

distinct-agg-push-down.description: Whether support pushing down aggregation with distinct to cop task

txn-total-size-limit.description: The limitation of the size in byte for the entries in one transaction.If using TiKV as the storage, the entry represents a key/value pair.NOTE: If binlog is enabled with Kafka (e.g. arbiter cluster),this value should be less than 1073741824(1G) because this is the maximum size that can be handled by Kafka.If binlog is disabled or binlog is enabled without Kafka, this value should be less than 1099511627776(1T).

txn-entry-size-limit.description: The limitation of the size in byte for each entry in one transaction.NOTE: Increasing this limit may cause performance problems.

max-txn-ttl.description: max lifetime of transaction ttl manager.

gogc.description: The Go GC trigger factor, you can get more information about it at https://golang.org/pkg/runtime.If you encounter OOM when executing large query, you can decrease this value to trigger GC earlier.If you find the CPU used by GC is too high or GC is too frequent and impact your business you can increase this value.

lite-init-stats.description: Whether to use the lite mode of init stats.

force-init-stats.description: Whether to wait for init stats to finish before providing service during startup

networks.description: PROXY protocol acceptable client networks.Empty string means disable PROXY protocol, * means all networks.

header-timeout.description: PROXY protocol header read timeout, unit is second

rpc-metrics.description: Whether to enable the rpc metrics.

type.description: Type specifies the type of the sampler: const, probabilistic, rateLimiting, or remote

param.description: Param is a value passed to the sampler.Valid values for Param field are:- for "const" sampler, 0 or 1 for always false/true respectively- for "probabilistic" sampler, a probability between 0 and 1- for "rateLimiting" sampler, the number of spans per second- for "remote" sampler, param is the same as for "probabilistic"and indicates the initial sampling rate before the actual oneis received from the mothership

sampling-server-url.description: SamplingServerURL is the address of jaeger-agent's HTTP sampling server

max-operations.description: MaxOperations is the maximum number of operations that the samplerwill keep track of. If an operation is not tracked, a default probabilisticsampler will be used rather than the per operation specific sampler.

sampling-refresh-interval.description: SamplingRefreshInterval controls how often the remotely controlled sampler will polljaeger-agent for the appropriate sampling strategy.

queue-size.description: QueueSize controls how many spans the reporter can keep in memory before it starts droppingnew spans. The queue is continuously drained by a background go-routine, as fast as spanscan be sent out of process.

buffer-flush-interval.description: BufferFlushInterval controls how often the buffer is force-flushed, even if it's not full.It is generally not useful, as it only matters for very low traffic services.

log-spans.description: LogSpans, when true, enables LoggingReporter that runs in parallel with the main reporterand logs all submitted spans. Main Configuration.Logger must be initialized in the codefor this option to have any effect.

local-agent-host-port.description: LocalAgentHostPort instructs reporter to send spans to jaeger-agent at this address

pd-server-timeout.description: Max time which PD client will wait for the PD server in seconds.

grpc-connection-count.description: Max gRPC connections that will be established with each tikv-server.

grpc-keepalive-time.description: After a duration of this time in seconds if the client doesn't see any activity it pingsthe server to see if the transport is still alive.

grpc-keepalive-timeout.description: After having pinged for keepalive check, the client waits for a duration of Timeout in secondsand if no activity is seen even after that the connection is closed.

grpc-compression-type.description: The compression type for gRPC channel: none or gzip.

commit-timeout.description: Max time for commit command, must be twice bigger than raft election timeout.

max-batch-wait-time.description: Max batch wait time in nanosecond to avoid waiting too long. 0 means disable this feature.

batch-wait-size.description: Batch wait size, to avoid waiting too long.

region-cache-ttl.description: If a Region has not been accessed for more than the given duration (in seconds), itwill be reloaded from the PD.

store-limit.description: store-limit is used to restrain TiDB from sending request to some stores which is up to the limit.If a store has been up to the limit, it will return error for the successive request in same store.default 0 means shutting off store limit.

store-liveness-timeout.description: store-liveness-timeout is used to control timeout for store liveness after sending request failed.

ttl-refreshed-txn-size.description: ttl-refreshed-txn-size decides whether a transaction should update its lock TTL.If the size(in byte) of a transaction is large than `ttl-refreshed-txn-size`, it update the lock TTL during the 2PC.

resolve-lock-lite-threshold.description: If the number of keys that one prewrite request of one region involves exceed this threshold, it will use `ResolveLock` instead of `ResolveLockLite`.

capacity-mb.description: The capacity in MB of the cache. Zero means disable coprocessor cache.

max-retry-count.description: max retry count for a statement in a pessimistic transaction.

deadlock-history-capacity.description: The max count of deadlock events that will be recorded in the information_schema.deadlocks table.

deadlock-history-collect-retryable.description: Whether retryable deadlocks (in-statement deadlocks) are collected to the information_schema.deadlocks table.

pessimistic-auto-commit.description: If true it means the auto-commit transactions will be in pessimistic mode.

engines.description: engines means allow the tidb server read data from which types of engines. options: "tikv", "tiflash", "tidb".

tidb_general_log.description: tidb_general_log is used to log every query in the server in info level.

tidb_pprof_sql_cpu.description: tidb_pprof_sql_cpu is used to add label sql label to pprof result.

ddl_slow_threshold.description: ddl_slow_threshold sets log DDL operations whose execution time exceeds the threshold value.

tidb_expensive_query_time_threshold.description: tidb_expensive_query_time_threshold indicates the time threshold of expensive query.

tidb_force_priority.description: Force the priority of all statements in a specified priority.The value could be "NO_PRIORITY", "LOW_PRIORITY", "HIGH_PRIORITY" or "DELAYED".

tidb_check_mb4_value_in_utf8.description: check mb4 value in utf8 is used to control whether to check the mb4 characters when the charset is utf8.

tidb_enable_slow_log.description: Whether to enable slow query log.

tidb_slow_log_threshold.description: Queries with execution time greater than this value will be logged. (Milliseconds)

tidb_record_plan_in_slow_log.description: tidb_record_plan_in_slow_log is used to enable record query plan in slow log.0 is disable. 1 is enable.

max_connections.description: The maximum permitted number of simultaneous client connections. When the value is 0, the number of connections is unlimited.

tidb_enable_ddl.description: Run ddl worker on this tidb-server.
